title: Page of Cups Meaning - Tarot Card Meanings

Comparing the Page of Cups across different tarot decks.

description: The Page of Cups represents the unexpected inspiration that comes to us from the unconscious, perhaps in ways that we may not truly understand. In this card, a youth at the seashore wears a blue tunic adorned with floral prints, and holds a golden cup. She also wears a beret that looks quite bohemian, and a long flowing scarf. She is surprised by a fish that pops out of the cup, as if to greet her from a fairytale. She can neither drink nor toast with the cup as the fish stares at her and seemingly tries to engage with her.

upright.overview:
One of the most important meanings within the Page of Cups is that you should be open to new ideas, especially ones that stem from intuitive inspiration. The card seems to state that such inspiration should be embraced, despite it being something that you may not expect. It could lead you to adventure and open many doors. If it is a calling of a creative nature, for example, one to get into music or art, there's an especially strong push from this card to go for it.
When you are being faced by difficult situations, and you have stopped chasing your dreams, the Page of Cups seems to say that you that you should tackle the issue from a totally different perspective. It symbolizes persistence as this is the only way that you can make your dreams come true. Listen to your intuition, follow your calling, and believe everything is possible.

It symbolizes persistence as this is the only way that you can make your dreams come true.

For those that are afraid to reveal their emotions, the Page of Cups could mean that it is time to release and show those emotions. The creative you and the emotional you should both be expressed, no matter how insignificant they may seem. In most cases, some people cannot express themselves as they want to protect their ego. The Page of Cups indicates that it is alright to have a new beginning - to welcome the real you.
upright.love_meaning: The person represented by the Page of Cups tarot love meaning is someone who is intuitive, creative and emotional. They can often have an innocent and naive quality, regardless of their actual age. If this card doesn’t point to a person in your life right now, happy surprises could be in store for you. If you’re already in a relationship, you may be looking at it with fresh eyes, a sense of wonder and awe, and a newfound appreciation for the parts of your partner that you haven’t seen before. If you’re single, your approach to love can be one of childlike fascination. Everything about romance and potential partners can feel delightfully novel to you.
upright.career_meaning: The page of cups is an imaginative, sensitive and creative person, and in a career reading, they can often signal a focus on creative fields like art, fashion, poetry and music, or any field in which they can use their innate talent to create something. The page of cups can often have trouble putting their feelings into words, and thus, their creative outlets tend to be places where they can express themselves. They often have their head in the clouds however, so ensure that you are not simply daydreaming about your work goals, and are actually putting effort and taking action to make them become real. Follow your dreams, but make sure that they are well grounded in reality first.
upright.finances_meaning: When it comes to finances, the page of cups can suggest daydreaming, and perhaps financial goals that are unrealistic. It may be better for your long term future to focus on things that are achievable, and completing goals one at a time instead of hoping for the lottery, or another risky investment to bring you what you desire.
upright.as_feelings:
The upright Page of Cups reveals a sense of youthful curiosity and emotional openness. This person is enchanted by your presence, feeling inspired and drawn to the possibilities ahead. Their feelings brim with creativity and imagination, hinting at the potential for something beautiful between you two. They may be experiencing a mix of excitement and vulnerability as they navigate their emotions.
As for your own feelings, the Page of Cups suggests you're tapping into a more playful side. You might feel an awakening of emotions or intuition that urges you to explore deeper connections. A sense of hopefulness fills you, along with a willingness to express your feelings honestly, inviting new experiences while keeping your heart open on this journey.
upright.as_actions: When you draw the Page of Cups, you’re being asked to embrace your creativity and intuition. Now is the time to explore new ideas and express your emotions freely. Consider engaging in artistic activities like painting, writing, or music that allow you to channel your feelings into something tangible. This card encourages you to approach situations with a fresh perspective; look for inspiration in everyday life and be open to unexpected opportunities. Nurture relationships by reaching out with kindness or sharing heartfelt thoughts. Trust your instincts as they guide you toward deeper connections and personal growth, allowing yourself to dream without limits.
upright.love: fresh perspective on relationship, awe and wonder at love and romance
upright.career: finding a creative outlet at work, daydreams about career paths
upright.finances: unrealistic financial goals, daydreams without putting in effort

reversed.overview: Shy, hesitant and maybe a little awkward, the Page of Cups tarot love meaning can point to someone in your romantic life with these characteristics. They may react well to some much needed kindness, slowly opening up to you if they feel safe. Sometimes however, this person may also be a bit emotionally immature; there could be temper tantrums, insecurity, and lots of nonsense. Should this card not represent a person, be aware of these traits in yourself. Have your insecurities gotten the best of you? How have they affected your romantic life?
reversed.love_meaning: Shy, hesitant and maybe a little awkward, the Page of Cups tarot love meaning can point to someone in your romantic life with these characteristics. They may react well to some much needed kindness, slowly opening up to you if they feel safe. Sometimes however, this person may also be a bit emotionally immature; there could be temper tantrums, insecurity, and lots of nonsense. Should this card not represent a person, be aware of these traits in yourself. Have your insecurities gotten the best of you? How have they affected your romantic life?
reversed.career_meaning: Have you had issues dealing with your feelings at work? The page of cups can indicate that you have been unprofessional, or perhaps letting your emotions get the best of you. Oftentimes, when we are in new situations we may be faced with feelings that we don’t know how to channel into something positive. If your line of work is in a creative field, the reversed page of cups can also suggest that you’ve had a hard time dealing with creative blocks. This will pass too, if you can remember the reason you fell in love with doing what you did in the first place. Find inspiration.
reversed.finances_meaning: If you’ve been dealing with any financial setbacks, you’ll need to make sure that you have your emotions under control. Avoid letting yourself get carried away, and make any risky choices as a result. If you’ve been in denial about your financial state, now is the time to face it instead of running away. Many valuable lessons can be learned; and denial is only delaying the inevitable.
reversed.as_feelings:
As the Page of Cups appears in reverse, it highlights that someone close to you is wrestling with emotional immaturity or confusion. They may feel overwhelmed by their own feelings and struggle to express them clearly, leading to mixed signals or even avoidance. Their attraction might be clouded by insecurities or past disappointments, making it difficult for them to fully embrace what they feel for you.
When reflecting on your own emotions, the reversed Page of Cups indicates that you could be feeling disillusioned or disconnected from your romantic aspirations. You might find yourself questioning your desires and struggling with self-doubt, which can hinder your ability to connect deeply with others. This card encourages you to explore these feelings more thoroughly and seek clarity within yourself before pursuing new connections.
reversed.as_actions: The arrival of this card suggests a moment to focus on grounding your emotions and reconnecting with reality. This card indicates a need to step back from daydreams or unrealistic expectations, urging you to embrace practicality in your actions. Consider journaling your thoughts and feelings to gain clarity, allowing yourself to process any emotional turbulence. Engage in creative activities that have tangible outcomes, like painting or crafting, which can help channel your energy productively. Additionally, reach out for honest conversations with trusted friends about what truly matters to you right now; this will foster deeper connections and provide valuable insights into your current situation.

abyss: The Page of Cups is aboard a large ship. Behind him, the turbulent sea crashes and churns. He is not fazed by it, however; instead, he intently studies a map of the heart. His task is to ensure that the course of the ship has been properly charted. Regardless of what the journey may bring—whether waters calm or stormy—he must safely and skillfully navigate his craft through it. The Page of Cups represents pure emotion. He is innocent and wears his emotions on his sleeve. He is led by his heart, whatever the tangles and snarls that may entail. When the Page of Cups is present in your reading, it calls to you to be pure of heart and approach things with a sense of that same innocence. You can see things now that in the past you may have missed or considered unimportant. Channel your inner child; try to see things with a beginner's eyes. If you think back to your first love, it will give you an idea of how the Page of Cups sees the world.
